definition: to reduce penalty/shortened or commuted (judicial) sentence
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: Typically gw gold, such sentences are commuted to life in prison.
sentences.chinese: 通常情況下，這種判決都會減刑爲無期徒刑。

sentences.english: Anyone sentenced to death shall have the right to seek pardon or commutation of the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 任何被判處死刑的人應有權要求赦免或減刑。

sentences.english: People given a suspended death penalty typically have the sentence commuted.
sentences.chinese: 被判死緩的人通常會獲得減刑。

sentences.english: The death sentence may be commuted to life imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 他的死刑被減刑成終身監禁。

sentences.english: No commutation shall be decided unless by a legal procedure.
sentences.chinese: 非經法定程序不得減刑。

sentences.english: He was sentenced to five years, but should serve only three with remission.
sentences.chinese: 他被判了五年徒刑，但減刑後僅服刑三年。

sentences.english: Three days before Christmas, I granted executive clemency or commutations of sentences to sixty-two people.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節的前三天，我批准爲62名罪犯赦免或減刑。

sentences.english: In Arkansas the governor had to commute their sentences.
sentences.chinese: 而在阿肯色州，減刑必須經過州長的批准。

sentences.english: A successful completion of that treatment would take a year off his sentence.
sentences.chinese: 如果這些治療成功的話，他將可以減刑一年。

sentences.english: His death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 他的死刑被減刑成終身監禁。

sentences.english: However, no punishment shall be commuted without going through legal procedure.
sentences.chinese: 非經法定程序不得減刑。

sentences.english: In order to help mother commutation, Wang Shun says.
sentences.chinese: 爲了幫母親減刑，王順這樣說。

sentences.english: When Chu Kin was commuted to prison after 17 years.
sentences.chinese: 褚時健被判後減刑爲有期徒刑17年。

definition: to judge a case/to render a verdict/verdict
to commute a prison sentence to a fine (Tw)
to re-investigate/to investigate and reconsider a judgment
to release for medical treatment (of a prisoner)
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
